properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 9 at 10:02AM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Warning
for the following rivers in Mississippi...

Noxubee River At Macon affecting Noxubee County
Luxapallila Creek Near Columbus affecting Lowndes County

SYNOPSIS...

Heavy rainfall event is moving into the region beginning
Monday and going through Thursday.  These crests are based on 48 hours
of rainfall. Since this is only the first 2 days of the rainfall,
crest could go higer based on additional heavy rainfall beyond
48 hours.

The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Luxapallila Creek Near Columbus
* from Tuesday afternoon until further notice.
* At  9:00 AM Sunday the stage was 10.2 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
* Forecast...The creek will continue to fall for the next 24 to
36 hours before rising on additional rainfall. The river will rise
above flood stage early Tuesday afternoon and will continue to
rise to near 21.1 feet early Thursday morning.
* Flood history...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.0 feet
on Jan 5 2020.
* Impact...At 21.0 feet...Six to ten inches of water is flowing over
sections of Sand Road, Harrison Road, Gunshoot Road, and several
streets near Magby Creek.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet...Water is flowing over portions of sand road,
harrison road, and Gunshoot Road north of columbus. Residents in
columbus near magby and mccrary creeks should stay alert to
flooding and be ready to take precautions.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 48 hours.

Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.
